main.name: Matt Cheng
main.occupation: Full Stack Web Developer and Mechanical Engineer
main.description: On my down time, I love playing video games and producing music!
main.bio: I graduated from the University of California, Riverside with a Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering. During my undergradute career, I developed a passion for coding through my senior design project and from there I became a self-taught full stack web developer. I am currently seeking an opportunity to grow in a fast-paced environment with a team that can utilize my skills in both front-end and back-end web development.
main.contactmessage: If you like what you see, feel free to contact me and I would love to talk to you more about my experiences!

resume.frontend: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, JQuery, Git, React.JS, ES6, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator
resume.backend: Node.JS, Express.JS, EJS, SQL, MongoDB, Mongoose, Passport, OAuth 2.0
resume.mechE: CSWA (Certified SolidWorks Associate), AutoCAD, MATLAB, C/C++, Arduino, Machine Shop, MIG Welding 3-D Printing

work.title: Mechanical Engineer
work.description: I designed fully operational electrical substation enclosures, relay panels, and switchgears using AutoCAD. This required knowledge in a variety of engineering fields such as mechanical, electrical, and civil engineering. I worked cross-functionally with other engineering teams and communicated with customers weekly to give project updates and discuss project specifications.

work.title: Mechanical Engineer
work.description: I set up testing equipment and prepped automobiles onto chassis dynamometers for emission testing and verified that the emissions were within EPA and ARP standards. In addition, I calibrated the tools and emission test cells for EPA and ARP verification.

work.title: Junior Mechanical Engineering Intern
work.description: I work specifically with R&D in the company's automotive power tool division. I executed specification reviews and benchmark verifications of their new line of power tools. I also analyzed and repaired faulty customer tools.

projects.title: ToDoList App
projects.category: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.JS, Express.JS, and MongoDB

projects.title: Secrets App
projects.category: HTML, CSS, Node.JS, EJS, MongoDB, Passport, and OAuth 2.0

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
